snippet: With the passage of a bill that does little to address the country’s long-term debt issues, military and diplomatic experts wonder whether the United States is at risk of squandering its global influence.
abstract: News analysis; military and diplomatic experts wonder whether United States is at risk of squandering its global influence after passage of bill that does little to address country's long-term debt issues and by some measures may worsen them; some argue that debt has allowed Pres Barack Obama and other democrats to justify retreat from global engagement.
lead_paragraph: With the passage of a bill that does little to address the country’s long-term debt issues, military and diplomatic experts wonder whether the United States is at risk of squandering its global influence.

headline.seo: Debt Deal Fails to Allay Fears on U.S. Global Power
headline.main: Fiscal Deal Fails to Allay Doubts on U.S. Global Power
headline.print_headline: Fiscal Deal Fails to Allay Doubts About U.S. Power
